entry.title: gpu: Make SkiaGraphiteDawnImageRepresentation work for NV12 textures
entry.content:
NV12 textures are wrapped as R8BG8Biplanar420Unorm Dawn textures for

both legacy and non-legacy multi-planar shared images. Make the Graphite

Dawn image representation work for both cases for NV12:



1) for legacy NV12 images, pass the plane index to the representation so

it can pass it to Dawn as texture aspect when creating the texture

view for the plane and wrap it in a graphite backend texture.

2) for non-legacy NV12 images, create a texture view for each plane, and

wrap them in graphite backend textures.

3) for true single-plane images, wrap the dawn representation's texture

in a graphite backend texture like the current implementation.



With this change, playing video on youtube.com doesn't crash anymore

with or without multiplane video flags.



Bug: 1448003

Change-Id: I8f6e4c728cddbf0d3d000728fb3dcfa51712660b

entry.title: Implement double press and drag selection for web content.
entry.content:
Currently, users can double tap to select a word in an editable

environment. This CL allows users to expand the selection after a

double press by directly dragging after the second tap down (without

lifting after the tap down). This is similar to existing long press

drag behaviour, but initiated by a double press instead of a long press.



Summary of approach:



1. Add a tap_down_count property to kGestureTapDown events.

2. In blink::GestureManager, add selection behaviour to

HandleGestureTapDown if the tap down has tap_down_count > 1.

(Previously, the selection behaviour only occurred on the tap event.)

3. Re-use the existing LongPressDragSelector by allowing drag selection

to be initiated by a double press as well as a long press.



Doc with summary of the feature, approach and considerations:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kZeGeGXkBlNsIRVLs27YWuOEVqfn4IH1U1sxmqZ5QYU/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-I-9oPhncwGvKJeSMRe7kTA



WIP design doc for overall feature (see "Double Press and Drag"

sections. Note that this is primarily planned for CrOS but may also be

enabled for other platforms eventually):

go/cros-touch-text-editing#heading=h.tlmeepz7ip57



Bug: b:244116654, b:264824689

Change-Id: Id6cbc3b687c7c26549b33d86a2d5194bc3ffd910

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4297101

entry.title: [iOS][Bkmrks] Handle ancestor folder deletion in bookmarks code
entry.content:
Ancestor folder deletion was not properly handled in the following 3

bookmark classes.

- BookmarksEditorMediator: BookmarksEditorMediator needs to dismiss

view when any ancestor of the `self.bookmark` is deleted.

If however any ancestor of the `self.folder` is deleted then a

default parent folder is set to `mobile_node()` of the corresponding

bookmark model.

Also all instances of `_bookmark = nullptr` has been replaced with

`[self.delegate bookmarkEditorMediatorWantsDismissal:self]`. This

guarantees the invariant that `_bookmark` is never `nullptr`. Thus

avoiding the check `if (_bookmark) {...}` every time this variable is

accessed. Currently the code does not do this check which could

potentially create other bugs.

- BookmarksHomeMediator: If any ancestor of `self.displayedNode` is

deleted then `self.displayedNode` is set to `nullptr`.

- BookmarksFolderEditorViewController: If any ancestor of

`_folder` is deleted then this view is dismissed.

If however any ancestor of `_parentFolder` is deleted then a default

parent folder is set to `mobile_node()` of the corresponding

bookmark model.

Similar to `BookmarksEditorMediator` we ensure the invariant that

`_parentFolder` is never `nullptr`. Every `_parentFolder = nullptr` is

converted to `[self dismiss]`.



Bug: 1445457

Change-Id: Ife9d996ca3ebbab1f4635cc05fdf8eca8e2e2170

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4565643

entry.title: iwa: Check the IWA version during installation
entry.content:
When installing an Isolated Web App, we not only need to check that its

signatures are expected, but also that its manifest specifies the

expected version. This is especially important for policy-installed

IWAs.

When installing from command line in dev mode, however, we install any

version, just like we do not check the Web Bundle ID.

entry.title: [Enrollment] Mock EnrollmentLauncher with a factory.
entry.content:
In tests, enrollment launcher was mocked via global mock holder. Tests

used to set a mock before it is yanked by

EnrollmentLauncher::Create function called by a launcher's consumer

(e.g. enrollment screen). It was one time set after which tests needed

to set another mock, and had to know when to do so.



Now, tests have full control and access to the launcher's mock and can

easily set and reset expectations. Tests have no care about when

fake enrollment launchers, connected to the mock, are created and used.

Tests can inject fake enrollment launchers via factory override.

entry.title: Prerender: Allow prerendering pages to create blob URL
entry.content:
Previously, prerendering pages cannot create blob URLs, as this API

uses a sync IPC to communicate, and we would cancel prerendering by

default in this case to ensure prerendering is safe.

After auditing it (see reasoning), we think creating an object URL seems

safe, and we can grant it during prerendering.



Reasoning:

- The blob url should be same-origin as the prerendering origin, so we

do not touch other origins.

- The security concerns should be addressed by this API.

https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#security-discussion

entry.title: [GPU] Do not stretch image in CopySharedImage() for multiplanar
entry.content:
Currently, CopySharedImageHelper::CopySharedImage() stretches the

source image when copying it if the caller-specified destination rect is

smaller than the size of the whole destination image. This is

semantically incorrect: it should instead clear the image and copy only

into the destination rect.



This CL changes behavior for the case where the destination is

multiplanar to clear the destination image if necessary and then

populate only |dest_rect|.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix Incognito intersitial with Locked Incognito tabs
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue with the Incognito interstitial i.e. opening an

external link in Incognito through the interstitial fails if the user

has locked their Incognito tabs. This occurs because the reauth agent

dismisses all view controllers presented over the browser, including the

Incognito interstitial (this happens in the scene controller). As a

result, the Incognito interstitial coordinator is stopped and `self` is

nil in the reauth callback, so the tab opener cannot be invoked.



Possible solutions:

1. Make the interstitial an exception to that dismissal behavior.

2. Refactor the completion passed to the reauth agent so that `self` is

not required anymore.

3. Simplify the interstitial by abstracting away the reauth requirement

and instead simply forwarding the responsibility to invoke reauth to

the tab opener.

This CL implements the latter.



Fixed: 1450484

Change-Id: I105590ed4cb30aaea6f7dbf05f4e1358e7e80007

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4580427

Commit-Queue: Quentin Pubert

Reviewed-by: Gauthier Ambard

Reviewed-by: Elmehdi Rahmaoui

entry.title: ukm: allow enabling UKM for kiosk
entry.content:
If UMA, crash reporting and URL-keyed metrics are enabled, let UKM be

uploaded for kiosks.

We do not want to enable the whole chrome sync for kiosk apps to avoid

syncing data across sessions, but we want to let enterprise admins to

control whether UKM reporting is enabled or disabled for kiosks via

UrlKeyedAnonymizedDataCollectionEnabled and MetricsReportingEnabled

policies.



Bug: b:276901560

Test: web kiosk with enabled UKM on dut, chrome://ukm

entry.title: [CSP] Fix CSP check for strict-dynamic with kSuppressReporting
entry.content:
The CSP checks take a parameter reporting_disposition which allows to

suppress reporting. The checks should return the same value

independently of that. Because of a mistake,

CSPDirectiveListAllowFromSource was behaving differently for a script

with url https://url.test in the case CSP: script-src 'strict-dynamic'

https://url.test depending on the reporting disposition.



This CL fixes that and prevents future mistakes by unifying the

checking logic. Unit tests are expanded to always check both variants.



Bug: 1299199

entry.title: inputs: allow InputMethodController::ReplaceText to have an option to move the caret after the replacing text
entry.content:
Following up on the new API ExtendSelectionAndReplace/ReplaceSurroundingText that was recently introduced into ChromeOS inputs, we want to have an option that moves the caret right after the committed text. This caret behavior is necessary for some ChromeOS features, including autocorrect.



This CL extends InputMethodController::ReplaceText to have another parameter that can allow us to move the caret right after the committed text.



Change-Id: Ie13457a7cb11253fc3e759bf29166aaa594ff6a6

entry.title: siso: rewrite rewrapper-to-reproxy by reading `-cfg` in rewrapper args
entry.content:
(this depends on https://crrev.com/c/4576741 being submitted.)



this approach is potentially slower (however cannot be verified at the moment as siso's reproxy implementation at time of writing is experimental and incomplete) than broadly applying hardcoded reproxy flags via StepRule depending on whether the action is clang, python, ts, mojo etc.



however right now we are prioritizing siso supporting drop-in use_remoteexec=true behavior regardless of action type, so this implementation is simpler. later, we can investigate whether it's worthwhile to hardcode reproxy config depending on the action type.

entry.title: Change the name of virtual device "Built-in speaker"
entry.content:
The virtual device "Built-in speaker" is used when the device doesn't

support simultaneous playback. In this case, an internal speaker and a

headphone will be merged into one virtual device. Change the name to

"Built-in speaker/headphone" to make it more understandable.

entry.title: [lacros] Add additional logging for session debugging
entry.content:
This CL adds further logging to command_storage_backend and some

lacros-specific logging to callsites of LoadTabsFromLastSession().



For affected users, session reads are triggered for both tab

and session restore when the lacros process is first started in

windowless mode. This does not occur for unaffected users.

Understanding what specifically is tripping this code path should

help in root causing the restore failures.



Logs in the command_storage_backend will give better insight into

how session files are being handled. Logs in code calling

TabRestoreService::LoadTabsFromLastSession() will help to understand

if this is being run at unexpected times during startup, potentially

influencing the resulting restore state.



Lacros specific overrides to the VLOG level at these callsites

have been added to avoid users needing to run the latest version

of both ash and lacros for the logs to begin appearing in user logs.



Bug: 1424800, 1450427

Change-Id: I365590f8665d02b3619fc7bf6e5ec582b88a0ac9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577089

Commit-Queue: Thomas Lukaszewicz

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1152340}

entry.title: Enable Chrome OS support for SystemPowerMonitor
entry.content:
On Chrome OS, energy metrics collection works the same way as on Linux, which also gets data from perf event and requires '/proc/sys/kernel/perf_event_paranoid' set to 0.

Modifying the paranoid's value needs sudo permission, so it requires developer mode to use SystemPowerMonitor on Chrome OS.

entry.title: Notify observers when FullScreenHtmlApiHandler exits full screen.
entry.content:
This change updates the FullScreenHtmlApiHandler onExitFullscreen method to notify observers when we exit full screen through calls to exitPersistentFullscreenMode.



Initially this started as an investigation for why full screen pip

would try to render the entire site when the device is locked/unlocked.



The actual problem here is that when the activity stops, the

FullScreenHtmlApiHandler calls exitPersistentFullscreenMode(),

which sets mPersistentModeSupplier to false. As a result, when we

finally call onExitFullScreen, observers are not notified since

wasInPersistentFullscreenMode is already set to false.



Bug: 1443087

Change-Id: I34305a3fa50c7eb80267064bed23477dad2f649b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4553458

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

entry.title: Fix a bunch of invalid uses of StringPiece::data()
entry.content:
A StringPiece is a pointer/length pair and not guaranteed to be

NUL-terminated. Passing .data() into a function that expects a

NUL-terminated const char * is invalid and will go out-of-bounds

(security bug) if the StringPiece didn't happen to created from a

NUL-terminated value.



Fortunately, most StringPieces are created from buffers that happen to

be NUL-terminated, but we cannot safely rely on this. This fixes a

bunch of instances I found looking through code search, most of it in

ash. Some observations:



- Some code converts StringPiece to string by calling .data(). This is

unnecessary because there is already a conversion defined.



- StringPrintf does not work well with StringPiece. I converted to

string or used StrCat.



- When functions take const std::string& and the caller has a

StringPiece, it is a common mistake to call .data(). This is

incorrect, but. To reduce the risk of people making that mistake

again, I converted a few functions to StringPiece where it was easy.



Change-Id: I9978c11adbc6f36acf0401e765e4495bdbe8c470

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4573916

Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

entry.title: [MTE] Use 16B ref count for MTE+BRP
entry.content:
If memory tagging is enabled with BRP previous slot, the MTE tag and BRP ref count will cause a race. To prevent this, the ref_count_size is increased to the MTE granule size and the ref count is not tagged.

entry.title: Rename LayoutBox::CanBeProgrammaticallyScrolled to IsUserScrollable
entry.content:
The original name was bad because it didn't return true for a

LayoutBox with overflow:hidden with overflow.



It had two callers:

1. MouseEventManager::HandleMousePressEvent(),

2. LayoutBox::CanBeScrolledAndHasScrollableArea() which had several

callers.



The original function was like:

return IsScrollContainer() && (HasScrollableOverflow() ||

IsDocumentNode() ||

HasEditableStyle());

while CanBeSrolledAndHasScrollableArea() was like:

return CanBeProgrammaticallyScrolled() && HasScrollableOverflow();

which was equivalent to

return HasScrollableOverflow();



So CanBeProgrammaticallyScrolled and CanBeScrolledAndHasScrollableArea

are combined into IsUserScrollable.



Potential behavior changes are:

1. For caller #1 about non-scrollable document or editable nodes

(the function previously returned true, now returns false),

but the caller doesn't seem to want the non-scrollable nodes [1].

2. For callers #2 about overflow:hidden on or with

overflow (the function previously returned true, now returns

false), but all callers (except for IntersectionObservation [2])

seem to want user-scrollable scrollers only.



[1] The editable case was added in https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/be62a516f9687d1d1b28248bb03f736eafe5498c%5E%21/

(thanks to szager@ for tracking to it) to support autoscroll

in overflow:hidden editable elements. However, I tried such a

case in Chrome, Firefox and Safari, and autoscroll (on selection)

only works in Safari. Middle click autoscroll also doesn't work

in Chrome and Firefox. Scroll on caret move is not affected by

this CL.



[2] IntersectionObservation::CanUseCachedRects() ignores normal

overflow:hidden scroll containers, but treated overflow:hidden

view as scrollable. This CL makes LayoutView behaves the same as

normal scrollers for IntersectionObservation. This will be fixed

in a followup.



Change-Id: Iff063513a695ac9c2c76a755f53fd6d6a77abe17

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4568249

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1152296}

entry.title: Fetch: Support BYOB reading for Response.body
entry.content:
ReadableByteStream is a variant of ReadableStream specialized for

bytes[1]. Given the performance benefits, this CL adds BYOB support

for Fetch by making Response.body a byte stream to allow for reading

with a bring-your-own-buffer(BYOB) reader.



The corresponding spec PR for this was landed at https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/pull/1593.



[1] https://streams.spec.whatwg.org/#readable-byte-stream



Low-Coverage-Reason: Behavior changes are covered by WPTs (i.e. response-consume-stream.any.js and Blob-stream.any.js).

Bug: 1243329, 1189621

entry.title: [Foldables] Hide activity tab when the activity is hidden during
entry.content:
activity recreation



Currently, the activity tab is hidden when the activity is hidden during

activity recreation only when tab reparenting is not in progress;

unfolding a device triggers tab reparenting before

ChromeActivity#onActivityHidden is invoked so the activity tab is not

essentially hidden at this time. After the activity is recreated in this

case, a call to ChromeActivity#onActivityShown is unable to invoke

Tab#show as expected because the tab is not hidden in the first place.

It is therefore necessary for Tab#hide to be invoked at the correct time

in this process to render the web contents / show the tab correctly.



This CL adds an alternate check on

AsyncTabParamsManager#hasParamsForTabId to hide the tab in

ChromeActivity#onActivityHidden in the event that tab reparenting is

already in progress.



Bug: 1432051

Change-Id: I38dadbef15818768cd54f6a76bfc6fb155ee2c25

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4582990

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: Adds Browser::is_delete_scheduled and fixes some usage
entry.content:
When the last tab is removed from a browser the window is closed, a

post task is scheduled, and when the post task runs the Browser is

deleted. This can not be undone.



The current code assumes no WebContents will be added between the

time the tabstrip is empty and the time the browser is deleted.

Unfortunately, because of the delay, it is possible for a WebContents

to be inserted and bad things to happen.



We could make Browser delete any remaining WebContents, but this

is problematic for two reasons:

1. Code adding the WebContents is likely assuming the Browser is

visible.

2. The WebContents may have unload handlers, which can not be handled

synchronously.



Because of this, we should explicitly disallow (CHECK) if a

WebContents is added to a Browser about to be deleted.



This patch adds a member to Browser so that you can tell if it is

about to be deleted, fixes some places that were adding WebContents,

and adds a DumpWithoutCrashing() to help identify problematic

places. The goal is to convert DumpWithoutCrashing() to a CHECK.



Bug: 1434387





Change-Id: Iabfebc8705859144cf430b06cd032b26a28e0abd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577858

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

entry.title: [VC] NotifyDeviceUsedWhileDisabled after HandleMediaUsageUpdate.
entry.content:
The DeviceUsedWhileDisabled notification will be an AnchoredNudge,

which is only visible if the tray is visible; so we have to call

HandleMediaUsageUpdate first to show the tray..



BUG=b:260793424

TEST="autoninja -C out/Test chrome/test:browser_tests && out/Test/browser_tests --gtest_filter=VideoConferenceAppServiceClientTest.*"

entry.title: Fixed null pointer read in gl::DCLayerTree::AddDelegatedInkVisualToTreeIfNeeded.
entry.content:

The fix is to call AddDelegatedInkVisualToTreeIfNeeded only if

root_surface_visual is set.

entry.title: [ SavedTabGroup ] Handle crash when groups change before restoration
entry.content:
Handles the case where the tabs of a group change before session restore

takes place. This can happen in scenarios where the browser crashes, and

a user opens a group, modifies it, closes it, then clicks the restore

button.



NOTE:

This does not work with group color / title changes propagating after a restore.



Bug: 1448275
